intro: Pariana gracilis, commonly known as the slender pariana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pariana gracilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
